themes: Need for direct support of artist-led and community-rooted organizations
Distrust of external consultants and institutions not accountable to local communities
Call for transparency and streamlined processes in funding
Demand for multi-year and general operating support
Emphasis on accessibility, cultural equity, and sustainability for marginalized groups
key_phrases: More direct support for artist-led and community-rooted organizations
trust and invest in existing cultural leaders
not redirect resources to outside consultants and institutions
more multi-year or general operating support
Prioritize accessibility, cultural equity, and the sustainability of organizations already serving Austin’s BIPOC, working-class, immigrant, and displaced artists
barriers_identified: Resources redirected to outside consultants and institutions not led by or accountable to Austin’s creative communities
Insufficient support for BIPOC, working-class, immigrant, and displaced artists
solutions_proposed: Provide more direct support for artist-led and community-rooted organizations
Trust and invest in existing cultural leaders
Do not redirect resources to outside consultants and institutions
Offer more multi-year or general operating support
Prioritize accessibility, cultural equity, and sustainability for organizations serving marginalized communities
